(a) To the maxumum extent that Texas law in effect from time to time
permits limitation of the liability of directors and officers of a corporation, no director or
officer of the Corporation shall be liable to the Corporation or to any shareholder for money
damages Neither the amendment nor repeal of Article 7(a), nor the adoption or amendment
of any other provision of these Articles of Incorporation inconsistent with this Article 7(a),
shall apply to or affect in any respect the applicability of the preceding sentence with respect
to any act or failure to act which occurred prior to such amendment, repeal or adoption. No
director of the Corporation shall be liable to the Corporation or its shareholders for monetary
damages for an act of omission in the director’s capacity as a director except for liability of a
director for (1) a breach of a director’s duty of loyalty to the Corporation or its shareholders,
(11) an act or omission not in good faith or that involves intentional misconduct or a knowing
violation of the law, (111) a transaction form which the director received an improper benefit,
whether or not the benefit resulted from an action taken within the scope of the director’s
office, (iv) an act or omission for which the liability of a director is expressly provided for
by a statute, or (v) an act related to an unlawful stock repurchase or payment of a dividend.
If the Texas Business Corporation Act, the Texas Miscellaneous Corporation laws Act, or
